Effective from date for the learning certification rule.
Effective to date for the learning certification rule.
Indicates whether the learning certification rules are to appear on Learning Content.
Indicates whether the learning certification rule is inactive.
Inactivation date for the learning certification rule.

Manage_Learning_Certification_Rule_Data.description: Contains detailed information about a learning certification rule.

validation.validation: Workday automatically timestamps the inactivation date. You can't change the date.
Specify an Effective From date that's before the Effective To date.
You need to set the rule to active before you can change its values.
You cannot initiate this action because there are pending actions that prevent you from initiating this action.
You can't change the certification in this rule. To update the certification, create a new certification rule.
To activate a certification rule, ensure that the certification is active.
To create a certification rule, ensure that the certification is active.
This learning content is inactive. To add content to a certification rule, ensure that the content is active.

description: Contains all the request data to add or update Learning Certification Rules

Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Indicates the transaction should process to completion before the response is generated.  Note: All < v12 operations will process with Run_Now = True for backwards compatibility but please review this setting in your environment for performance conditions.

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

description: Container for the processing options for a business process. If no options are submitted (or the options are submitted as 'false') then the business process is simply initiated as if it where submitted on-line with approvals, reviews, notifications and to-do's in place. If the Initiator is an Integration System User, any validations you configured on the Initiation step are ignored.
